abstract: Lawyer for former Dewey & LeBoeuf chairman Steven H Davis gives closing arguments in New York State Supreme Court case; holds prosecutors have failed to prove Davis was aware that firm, which collapsed in 2012, was fraudulent in reporting its revenue to lenders and creditors.
lead_paragraph: The lawyer for Steven H. Davis argued that prosecutors had failed to prove the former chairman of Dewey & LeBoeuf was aware of any wrongdoing before the law firm’s collapse in 2012.

headline.main: Dewey & LeBoeuf Chairman’s Lawyer Cites ‘Fantasy Fraud’
headline.print_headline: Dewey & LeBoeuf Chairman’s Lawyer Cites ‘Fantasy Fraud’

snippet: The lawyer for Steven H. Davis argued that prosecutors had failed to prove the former chairman of Dewey & LeBoeuf was aware of any wrongdoing before the law firm’s collapse in 2012.
